item.title: Need some advice on a SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

there were quite a few mistakes here… I’ll try to explain some… but first… here is what you are trying to achieve I believe. You were going around it the long way.

program WildFinder;

{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
{.include SRL\SRL\misc\wilderness.scar}

begin
  if InWilderness then
    writeln('You are in the wilderness')
  else
    writeln('You are not in the wilderness');
end.

A few quick pointers on your example (not covering in depth).

-The procedure for outputting text is WriteLn not WriteIn.
-Your report procedure is missing it’s initial ‘begin’.
-You are nesting the procedure inwild within a function. possible with delphi not SCAR though.
-Instead of the statement inwilderness:wildy; , you would put Wildy:=InWilderness; which
assigns your boolean variable with the current result of InWilderness.
-You are declaring a function InWilderness, but that already exists in wilderness.scar , the whole point of
including it.

  • the syntax for the writein procedures are wrong, even if it was WriteLn.
  • you don’t need to terminate the include statement, SCAR knows you are referencing a library file. That
    termination should go after the program declaration.
    -You’re not using constants so don’t want that declaration.
    -When using if … then if you are only executing one line of code, you don’t need the begin and end. it will execute the first line.

I hope that is helpful… I would recommend getting hold of a good tutorial and reading up on some SCAR basics. maybe even the helpfile in SCAR.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice on a SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“KyleGut3, post:4, topic:4879”]actually, there are both my green tractor friend.

Functions are used as a boolean mostly, I.e.

function blah :boolean; begin if(GetColor(124,652)=0)then begin result:= true; end; end; [/quote]

Okay, i was wrong.

item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

actually, there are both my green tractor friend.

Functions are used as a boolean mostly, I.e.

function blah :boolean;
begin
  if(GetColor(124,652)=0)then
  begin
    result:= true;
  end;
end;

item.title: Need some advice on a SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @omgh4x0rz omgh4x0rz
item.description:
@omgh4x0rz wrote:

try this

program retswildfinder

{.include srl\srl\misc\wilderness.scar};
{.include srl.scar};

const
loop = true; // Put "True" if you want to constantly detect wilderness level

procedure inwild;
begin
if (wildy = true) then
begin
 writein 'You are in the wilderness';
end
 else
 writein 'You are not in the wilderness';
end;


begin
inwild;
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some advice on a SCAR script

item.title: Need some advice on a SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @retributionmike retributionmike
item.description:
@retributionmike wrote:

This is my first attempt at making a script, its VERY simple, just sees if your in the wilderness and reports if you are or not. It uses SRL.

[code]program retswildfinder

{.include srl\srl\misc\wilderness.scar};

const

var
wildy: boolean;

function InWilderness:boolean;

procedure inwild;
begin
inwilderness:wildy;
goto report
end.

procedure report;
if (wildy = true) then
begin
writein ‘You are in the wilderness’;
end
else
writein ‘You are not in the wilderness’;
end;

begin
inwild;
end.[/code]

and I am getting an error at line 4.

Line 4: [Error] (4:20): 'BEGIN' expected in script

I thought i have a begin… :\ Im sure this is a pretty easy question. But again, this is my first attempt at making a SCAR script.

----------------------------edit----------------------------
I think i fixed something in it, im getting the same error but at line 14 now.

and omgh4x, yours didnt even use the InWilderness function. :\ thanks for trying though

Read full topic
item.source: Need some advice on a SCAR script
